parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I take down, pull down, depose, destroy. From kata and haireomai; to lower demolish.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To wrap up, roll round, envelop. From en and tulisso; to entwine, i.e. Wind up in.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Neuter 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Fine linen, a linen cloth. Of uncertain origin; byssos, i.e. Bleached linen.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A tomb, monument, memorial. From mnaomai; a memorial, i.e. Sepulchral monument.
Hewn out of the rock. From a compound of las and the base of xeros; rock-quarried.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Singular
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
